definition: catabolism (biology)/metabolic breaking down and waste disposal/dissimilation

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: But this kind of catabolism mainly concentrates on the banana skin.
sentences.chinese: 而这种分解代谢主要集中在香蕉皮上。

sentences.english: Raise blood sugar, stimulate catabolism, the hormone that mobilizes nutriment.
sentences.chinese: 升血糖，促进分解代谢，为营养物质动员激素。

sentences.english: Uric acid as the end-product of purine metabolism in human body is excreted through kidney.
sentences.chinese: 尿酸是人体嘌呤碱基分解代谢终产物，经肾脏排泄。

sentences.english: Both anabolism and catabolism are necessary for survival and good health.
sentences.chinese: 合成和分解代谢在对于身体健康很重要。

sentences.english: These processes are called anabolism and catabolism.
sentences.chinese: 这些过程叫作合成代谢和分解代谢。

sentences.english: A second experiment was designed to look for signs of catabolism.
sentences.chinese: 第二个设计的实验是企图寻找分解代谢的迹象。

sentences.english: When the banana is mature, the chlorophyll starts to decompose, this process is called the catabolism .
sentences.chinese: 当香蕉成熟时，叶绿素开始分解，此过程叫分解代谢。

definition: anabolism (biology)/constructive metabolism (using energy to make proteins etc)/assimilation
